sa733:1.2: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.
sa733:2.1: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks,
sa733:2.2: He bowed his head at his feet, withdrew to one side, and said to the Buddha,
sa733:2.4: Bhagavān, what are the factors of awakening?”
sa733:3.2: “The expression ‘factors of awakening’ refers to seven factors of the path, but monks gradually produce these seven factors of awakening by cultivating their fulfillment.”
sa733:4.1: That monk said to the Buddha,
sa733:4.2: “Bhagavān, how are these factors of awakening gradually produced by cultivating their fulfillment?”
sa733:5.2: “Suppose a monk mindfully abides observing the internal body as body.
sa733:5.3: When he mindfully abides observing the internal body as body, he collects his mind, ties it to mindfulness, and doesn’t forget it.
sa733:5.4: At that point, he skillfully cultivates the awakening factor of mindfulness.
sa733:5.5: After skillfully cultivating the awakening factor of mindfulness, he cultivates its fulfillment.
sa733:5.6: After fulfilling the awakening factor of mindfulness, he discriminates qualities and discerns and deliberates on them.
sa733:5.7: At that point, he cultivates skill in the awakening factor of discriminating qualities.
sa733:5.8: After cultivating it skillfully, he’ll cultivate its fulfillment.
sa733:5.9: It’s thus up to he’ll cultivate the fulfillment of the awakening factor of equanimity.
sa733:6.1: “As he mindfully abides contemplating the inner body as body, he thus mindfully abides observing the external body …
sa733:6.6: At that point, he focuses his mind, ties it to mindfulness, and doesn’t forget it.
sa733:6.7: *Up to the awakening factor of equanimity is also thus explained.*
sa733:6.8: Someone who thus abides will gradually produce the factors of awakening.
sa733:6.9: After gradually producing them, he cultivates their fulfillment.”
sa733:7.1: After the Buddha taught this sutra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.
